intro: Erythroxylum brevipedatum, commonly known as the short-stemmed erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, round berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
